item.title: Report E-2024080562
item.description:
Report E-2024080562

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-13
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On August 13, 2024, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN17914 was punctured by a nail and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. Crews collected one (1) 30-gallon pail of hypochlorite solution into one (1) 55-gallon over pack poly drum. Crews deployed additional granular absorbents to the hypochlorite solution and swept them in with hand tools. All spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum. On August 19, 2024, EWI returned to the site to process the request to transfer the hypochlorite solution material into a closed top drum. EWI transferred the hypochlorite solution from the damaged 30-gallon pail into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum.

item.title: Report E-2024080578
item.description:
Report E-2024080578

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-30
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN2680 Lithium Hydroxide release from a 50-pound poly bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived on-site and confirmed approximately 1 pound of product released affecting an 10’ x 7’ area of the trailer floor. It was determined the bag was torn due to contact with the trailer wall. The contractor collected and containerized the damaged bag of product and cleanup debris into a 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2024080582
item.description:
Report E-2024080582

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-26T06:17:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-29
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN1760 SR285 release from a 55-gallon metal drum. Contractors were dispatched to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 55-gallons of material released to a 75' x25' area of the concrete lot as well as the trailer floor due to a forklift puncture. Absorbents were deployed and worked into the impacted areas. The damaged drum was placed into a 95-gallon poly overpack. All impacted absorbents were containerized into (2) 55-gallon poly and (1) 65-gallon poly drums. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024080065
item.description:
Report I-2024080065

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: Kansas City
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: T FORCE FREIGHT
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Spill noticed in trailer prior to unloading, team recognized that half of a tote was missing and called our consultant Hazmat ONE. Team responded for cleanup and put all waste into three 55 gallon drums from the material that was cleaned up from the trailer and ground. No drains or soil was impacted.

item.title: Report X-2024081308
item.description:
Report X-2024081308

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-22T18:16:06+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-09
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE IN THE UNLOAD WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE, RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE SPILL PLACING ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THE ONE OF TWO BOTTLES HAD A SMALL CRACK IN THE BOTTLE. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THOUGH DMP.

item.title: Report X-2024080839
item.description:
Report X-2024080839

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-20T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO LEAKING PACKING IN THE UNLOAD WITH FULL PPE ON. USING THE DECISION TREE THE RESPONDER CLEANED UP THE LEAKING PACKAGE AND PLACED ALL MATERIAL IN A LINED SPILL TUB. THE RESPONDER TRANSPORTED THE MATERIAL TO DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. UPON ARRIVAL RESPONDER NOTED THAT 1 ONE GALLON BOTTLE WAS CRUSHED AND LEAKING. THE LEAKING BOTTLE LEAKED ON THREE OTHER BOTTLES. ALL MATERIAL WAS DISPOSED OF THROUGH DMP.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 980
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SCMA 2381 was reported to be releasing product from the top of the tank car when moved. Inspection of the car found no manway gasket in place. A temporary gasket of expanded Teflon was installed and the manway cover resecured.
